message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the process of decomposition. When a deer's body is broken down by worms and bacteria, the organic matter is consumed, leading to a reduction in mass. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer. Option (A) is incorrect because the body becomes smaller as it decomposes. Option (C) is incorrect because although some parts of the body may become less visible as decomposition occurs, the body itself does not become completely invisible. Option (D) is incorrect because the shape of the body changes as decomposition progresses.

Option (D) is incorrect because the decomposition process changes the shape of the body.
